metadata.title: CVE-2021-47312 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:netfilter: nf_tables: Fix dereference of null pointer flow In the casewhere chain->flags & NFT_CHAIN_HW_OFFLOAD is false thennft_flow_rule_create is not called and flow is NULL. The subsequent errorhandling execution via label err_destroy_flow_rule will lead to a nullpointer dereference on flow when calling nft_flow_rule_destroy. Since theerror path to err_destroy_flow_rule has to cater for null and non-nullflows, only call nft_flow_rule_destroy if flow is non-null to fix thisissue. Addresses-Coverity: ("Explicity null dereference")

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47312` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500 - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-e500mc - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc-smp - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-emb - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.13.0-173-powerpc64-smp - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-173-lowlatency - 3.11.0-12.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
